60 feet road, BEML 4th stage is a busy and commercial road with many shops and few houses. Waste collectors do not come by regularly. If they do they do not segregate dry and wet waste. Shops throw garbage in open sites. This is then burnt by garbage collectors as they say the collection truck does not come by here. As a result pigs and dogs are always loitering around.

This side drain has been dumped with construction material, mud from BWSSB pipeline, Garbage, Electric Poles, broken toilet pots and god knows what else. This has lead to the area becoming a dumping ground for garbage from nearby residents and this attracts a lot of stray cows and street dogs. Sometimes these street animals enter people homes and dirty the place with excrete and garbage bags.
